Specific Details: Senator Alice Mary Higgins nominated ActionAid to present the Safe Cities for Women campaign at a Council of Europe hearing on violence against women. ActionAid staff member presented the campaign. Following the meeting ActionAid staff member corresponded with the Senator to arrange a meeting between the Senator and colleagues from ActionAid Bangladesh with regard to the Safe Cities campaign.
Subject Matter: Senator Alice Mary Higgins nominated ActionAid to present the Safe Cities for Women campaign at a Council of Europe hearing on violence against women. ActionAid staff member presented the campaign. Following the meeting ActionAid staff member corresponded with the Senator to arrange a meeting between the Senator and colleagues from ActionAid Bangladesh with regard to the Safe Cities campaign.
Intended Results: Respond to the Senator's request::Present the Safe Cities for Women campaign at a Council of Europe hearing on on violence against women::Thank Senator Higgins for putting the Safe Cities for Women campaign forward::Facilitate a meeting between Senator Alice Mary Higgins and ActionAid Bangladesh while the Senator was in Dhaka
Lobbying Activities:
Exchanged emails in order to organise the presentation at the Council of Europe Hearing, to thank the Senator, and to organise a meeting between Senator Higgins and ActionAid Bangladesh.|Email|6-10::Followed up emails with phone calls.|Phone call|2-5::Thanked Senator Higgins on Twitter and tweeted photos of 
the Council of Europe hearing and the meeting between Senator Higgins and ActionAid Bangladesh.|Social Media|2-5
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Jo-Ann Enright, Communications, Campaigns and Digital Coordinator

Specific Details: Highlighting the work undertaken by the NYCI Development Education team in the context of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development and promoting the National Youth Health Programme and sexual reproductive health rights within youth work at the UNFPA conference in Nairobi in November 2019

Subject Matter: Highlighting the work undertaken by the NYCI Development Education team in the context of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development and promoting the National Youth Health Programme and sexual reproductive health rights within youth work at the UNFPA conference in Nairobi in November 2019
Intended Results: That the NYCI’s role in facilitating youth sector engagement with global issues would be clear.  Also to raise the role of the youth sector in relation to sexual reproductive health rights, undertaken as part of the National Youth Health Programme by NYCI. Also to impress upon the politicians the unique, trusted and vital role that youth workers play in responding to young peoples’ sexual and reproductive health queries and advocacy
